[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Function Name Injection] Can the func_name (Identifier) in FunctionDispatch be crafted to call privileged or internal functions that should not be accessible via native dispatch? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Type Argument Manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate ty_args (Vec<Type>) in FunctionDispatch to cause type confusion, violating Move's type safety guarantees and potentially accessing unauthorized resources? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Argument Ordering Attack] The comment emphasizes exact argument ordering for paranoid mode stack transition - can incorrect ordering be exploited to cause stack corruption or access wrong memory locations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Argument Count Mismatch] Does FunctionDispatch validate that the args SmallVec count matches the target function's expected parameter count, or can mismatched counts cause buffer overflows or underflows? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Value Type Mismatch] Are the Value types in args validated against the function signature's expected types, or can type-mismatched values cause runtime crashes or memory corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Recursive Dispatch] Can FunctionDispatch be used to create recursive dispatch chains that exhaust stack space or bypass recursion limits enforced by the Move VM? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Cross-Module Privilege Escalation] Can FunctionDispatch be used to call functions in privileged modules (e.g., system modules) from unprivileged contexts, bypassing access control checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Gas Metering Bypass via Dispatch] When dispatching to another function, is gas properly tracked across the dispatch boundary, or can dispatch chains be used to perform unbounded computation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [SmallVec Optimization Attack] The args field uses SmallVec<[Value; 1]> - can an attacker provide more arguments than fit inline to trigger heap allocation in performance-critical paths, causing DoS? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Reference Implementation Deviation] The comment refers to dispatchable_fungible_asset::native_dispatch as reference - can other implementations deviate unsafely from this pattern, introducing vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::LoadModule] [Module Loading Gas Bypass] The comment emphasizes charging before FunctionDispatch - can LoadModule be skipped or returned after FunctionDispatch, bypassing module loading gas charges? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::LoadModule] [Duplicate Module Loading] Can LoadModule be invoked multiple times for the same module_name to cause duplicate gas charges or load the same module repeatedly, wasting resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::LoadModule] [Module ID Validation] Does LoadModule validate that the module_name (ModuleId) refers to an existing, properly signed module, or can invalid module references cause VM errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::LoadModule] [Metering Context Obsolescence] The comment notes LoadModule is 'not used once metering in native context is enabled' - does this mean old code paths still exist that could be exploited if metering is disabled? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::LoadModule] [Module Loading Race Condition] Can concurrent LoadModule requests for the same module cause race conditions in module cache updates, leading to using stale or incorrect module versions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Impl: From<PartialVMError>] [Automatic Conversion Abuse] The TODO comment labels this conversion as 'VERY PROBLEMATIC' - can the automatic ? operator usage propagate non-invariant violations as InvariantViolations, violating the error contract? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Impl: From<PartialVMError>] [Error Misclassification] Does this From implementation properly distinguish between user errors (should be Abort), limit exceeded errors, and true invariant violations, or does it incorrectly classify everything as InvariantViolation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Impl: From<PartialVMError>] [Legacy Code Vulnerability] The comment says 'Please help us stop the bleed by not using this conversion' - are there existing native functions still using this conversion that could be exploited? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Impl: From<PartialVMError>] [Silent Error Promotion] Can legitimate user errors be silently promoted to InvariantViolation through this conversion, causing transactions to panic instead of gracefully aborting with proper error codes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Type: SafeNativeResult] [Error Propagation] Does SafeNativeResult properly propagate all error variants through Result combinators (map, and_then, etc.), or can error information be lost during propagation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Type: SafeNativeResult] [Panic on Unwrap] Can careless use of unwrap() or expect() on SafeNativeResult cause validator panics instead of proper error handling, leading to liveness failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Integration] [VM Error Handling Divergence] Do all native functions consistently use SafeNativeError conventions, or can inconsistent error handling across native functions cause state divergence between validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Integration] [Gas Metering Inconsistency] When metering in native context is enabled vs disabled, does the LimitExceeded behavior differ in ways that could cause non-deterministic transaction outcomes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Integration] [Error Serialization] Are SafeNativeError variants properly serialized across network boundaries, or can serialization/deserialization cause error information loss or corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Integration] [Speculative Error Handling] The comment mentions speculative errors for Block-STM - does error handling properly integrate with parallel execution, or can error states leak between speculative and committed executions? (Critical)
